actor1: KIO/KIA: Kachin Independence Organization/Kachin Independence Army
notes: On 24 October 2021, between Pang Lawt and Kar Lai village (Kutkai Township, Muse District, Shan-North), 90 villagers from Pang Lawt went to a forest to clear trees. Afterwards, about 20 KIA troops came to the locations and detained them. KIA tortured, beat and interrogated 6 of them. The KIA also seized knives and 14 motorcycles from them. After KIA released the farmers, they demanded a cow and 1,500,000 Myanmar kyats from farmers in exchange for their knives and 14 motorcycles. The KIA confirmed that this incident and stated that this was a form of punishment after farmers attempted to cut trees in a restricted area. The KIA claimed that they have constantly told villagers to not do farming in that particular area.

source: Myanmar Now; Democratic Voice of Burma

notes: Around 7 June 2021 (between 31 May - 12 June), near Waw Lay Myaing (Waw Lay) town (Myawaddy township, Myawaddy District, Kayin State), 25 men out of 47 people taken away by the KNDO on 31 May were found dead in a forest clearing. Seven of the bodies were discovered on 11 June, while 18 other bodies were found on 12 June. The military regime has accused the KNDO of killing civilians who were working on the construction of a bridge. The KNDO however claimed that the victims were undercover soldiers sent as spies by the military. The KNU headquarters has since issued a statement announcing that they will launch an investigation into the incident.

On 6 June 2021, in Magway town (Magway township, Magway district, Magway region), security forces (coded as military and police) beat up and arrested six university students in front of No. 3 Basic Education High School.

On 6 June 2021, on Minbu-Pwintbyu-Seik Phyu highway near Pwintbyu town (Minbu District, Magway Region), Myanmar military forces beat up passengers in a car said to be carrying township judges after the car refused to stop on the highway. Two civilians were injured.

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 5 June 2021, in Bant Bway village (Yinmarbin Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military stormed the village and opened fire. A female villager was shot and killed. One other civilian was arrested.

Two civilians died. One other was beaten and arrested. The Myanmar military took away and dissected the bodies of two youths and returned them to their respective families.

On 5 June 2021, in Danubyu township (Maubin District, Ayeyarwady Region), Myanmar military forces from the 108th Infantry Battalion fired shots at civilians passing by on a motorbike. One civilian died. One was injuried.
On 5 June 2021, in Hpat Mar village (Puta-O Township, Puta-O District, Kachin State), Myanmar military forces' vehicles hit a civilian. The civilian's leg was broken.

On 5 June 2021, in Ywar Thit village, Kyonpyaw Township (Pathein District, Ayeyarwady Region), a motorcyclist was shot and arrested by regime forces (coded as military and police) after he refused to stop his motorcycle for inspection. He was later pronounced dead during interrogation.

actor1: ULA/AA: United League of Arakan/Arakan Army

On 5 June 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a filmmaker at her house. She was beaten and seriously injured. Afterwards, she was hospitalized for 10 days.

On 4 June 2021, in Chaung Ma Gyi village (coded as Chaung Ma Gyi (East)) (Seikphyu township, Pakokku district, Magway region), security troops (coded as military and police) arrived in five vehicles at around 4am following reports from military informants. Five villagers were arrested by security forces, including a man who was also beaten for refusing to show security forces around the homes of targeted villagers. In addition, an old man riding a motorcycle was beaten and tortured by three members of security forces after he failed to stop for inspection.
On 4 June 2021, in Loikaw town (Loikaw Township, Loikaw District, Kayah State), the Myanmar military one-sidedly fired around the neighbourhood. A bullet hit and killed a man.
On 4 June 2021, at San Pya Chauk Maing village in Demoso Township (Loikaw District, Kayah State), the Myanmar military shot and killed a young man.

notes: On 4 June 2021, in Kyaukpadaung town (Nyaung-U District, Mandalay Region), Myanmar military forces opened fire at three people who were riding on a motorcycle. One LGBTQ civilian was killed. Two others were arrested.

On 4 June 2021, in Padan town (Ngape Township, Minbu District, Magway Region), Myanmar military forces fired shots at three civilians riding on a motorbike and attempted to arrest them. No injuries reported, and the three civilians escaped unharmed.

On 4 June 2021, mear Kyun Ka Lay village along the Yangon-Mandalay Highway in Hlegu Township (Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), Myanmar military forces inspecting the vehicles fired shots into a car after the car refused to be inspected. One civilian was killed. One other was arrested with a pistol.

On 4 June 2021, in Moe Bye town (Pekon Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), the Myanmar military broke into a church and took away three men and a 17-year-old-boy who were on security duty at the church. They were reportedly beaten up and used as human shields during fighting. The 17-year-old was forced to wear a bag with a bomb.

notes: On 3 June 2021, in Dawbon Township (Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), a military-appointed ward administrator for Bamar Aye ward killed at close range by unknown persons who fired three shots at the administrator.

On 3 June 2021, near a toll gate at the eastern entrance to Mandalay along the Mandalay-Pyin Oo Lwin road (Mandalay region), a police sergeant (assumed to be off-duty) riding a motorcycle towards Ohn Chaw police station was shot and killed at close range with pistols by four young men on motorcycles. The assailants then stabbed the police sergeant many times before escaping.

source: Radio Free Asia; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners
notes: On 3 June 2021, in Monywa town, Monywa township (Monywa District, Sagaing Region), security forces (coded as military and police) fired 4-5 shots and killed a man when he did not stop his motorcycle for an inspection. RFA and AAPP reported one killed.

On 3 June 2021, in Yae Le Gyi village (Pantanaw township, Maubin district, Ayeyarwady region), a villager attempted to stab a primary school assistant teacher who was not participating in the civil disobedience movement against the military coup earlier on the same day. The teacher did not sustain any injuries from the attack. It was reported that the villager had also planned to set fire to the school principal's house. The villager was arrested by security forces later the same day.

On 3 June 2021, in Kyaung Soe village (Kyauktaga township, Bago district, Bago-East), police arrested four family members at around 11pm after they failed to find the two targeted teachers who were on strike in support of the civil disobedience movement against the military coup. Locals stated that security forces fired shots and beat up the family members during the arrest.

On 3 June 2021, near Myauk See village, Kale Township (Kale District, Sagaing Region), three villagers who were returning from fishing were shot and wounded by military forces stationed at the police station. Military soldiers reportedly chased, shot and arrested the villagers.

On 3 June 2021, in Mahaaungmyay Township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested and beat up two people for being involved in the Sein Pan anti-coup protest group.

On 3 June 2021, in South Okkalapa township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), regime forces (coded as military and police) raided a residential area and fired around 20 shots. Four youths were shot and wounded while trying to evade arrest. Two of them managed to escape, while two others were detained. One of the youths reportedly sustained serious injuries. The reason for their arrests was not known.

On 3 June 2021, in Shwepyithar township (Yangon-north District, Yangon region), a man was beaten by security forces (coded as military and police) in Ward 10 and forced to take his daughter to school. Schools had been reopened by the military junta during this week despite strong opposition from anti-coup supporters.

On 3 June 2021, in Taunggyi town (Taunggyi Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), a photographer living in Market Quarter was beaten and arrested at his home by about 20 members of security forces (coded as military and police) at midnight. During the raid, security forces also beat up his mother, sister and another boy. Six other people were also arrested by security forces in Taunggyi on the same night.

notes: On 3 June 2021, at Aung Matta ward in Kale town (Kale Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), nine unknown gunmen covering their faces shot and killed a former ward administrator (under the Thein Sein's government) and his driver.

notes: On 2 June 2021, around Moe Bye town (Pekon Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), the Myanmar military shot two civilians with sniper. AAPP reported that one of them was shot in the forehead and died, while the other was seriously injured.

A group named TPC later claimed responsibility for the attack in a statement hours after the incident.

On 2 June 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), a deputy police chief was stabbed in the neck while riding a motorcycle (assumed to be off-duty) at around 8pm. He was taken to the hospital.

On 2 June 2021, in Pan Lin village (Mogoke township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), a former ward administrator was arrested by junta forces (coded as military and police). The administrator was reportedly beaten by security forces. He was charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code.

On 2 June 2021, in Sone Chaung village, Yinmarbin township (coded as Yinmarbin) (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region), security forces (coded as military and police) stormed the village and arrested five villagers. Security forces also opened fire at a villager who was watching from inside his house as they arrived in the village, hitting the villager in his thigh.

On 2 June 2021, in Myingyan town, Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay Region), two civilians riding a motorcycle were shot and wounded in their legs and arms after military forces fired shots at them.

notes: Around 2 June 2021 (as reported), between Pint Thar and Chat Gyi village in Kanbalu township (coded as Chat Gyi) (Kanbalu District, Sagaing Region), the military-appointed administrator of Chat Thin village was shot in the thigh while he was on his way back from a meeting.

On 2 June 2021, in Hswar town (Yedashe township, Taungoo district, Bago-East), a war veteran (a former medical practitioner under the military) was shot and killed by unknown persons while he was travelling to Ywa Thit village. He was dragged under a bridge before he was shot in the left part of his chest and body. It was reported that he might have been targeted for being accused of a military informant.

On 2 June 2021, in Mingaladon township (Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), the military arrested eight youths after an informant reported that they were allegedly storing weapons. Four of them were tied up and beaten near the Zayar Thiri Monastery.

On 2 June 2021, in Shwepyithar township (Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), five daily-wage workers who were working at a construction of the Mingalardon Military Hospital were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police). One of them later died on 3 June, reportedly due to torture by the security forces.

On 1 June 2021, in Mahaaungmyay Township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) stormed a Buddhist monastery and fired either rubber bullets or live rounds at monks who were holding a prayer service for the release of those detained by the military junta. A monk was injured while fleeing. No arrests were made.
